OVERVIEW               STRATEGY               ENVIRONMENTAL               SOCIAL               GOVERANCE               APPENDIX Product Sustainability |  27
OUR APPROACH
We believe that freedom of food choice 
matters and are committed to enabling 
healthier choices, by promoting transparency 
across our value chain. 
We strive to be a beacon of transparency and 
have a long history of advocating for national 
standards, like Non-GMO and USDA Organic, 
ensuring consumers have the information they 
need to make decisions about the food and 
products they purchase for their families. 
Demand for products that promote good health 
and positive environmental impacts continues 
to rise. From our private brands food scientists 
to our category management experts, we 
help our customers get the right products 
on the shelf. This includes delivering a wide 
selection of products adhering to the following 
sustainability certifications and regularly 
featuring these items in our publications and 
educational materials.
USDA ORGANIC
Organic growing practices are known to 
promote human and environmental health, 
including reduced pollution and use of 
pesticides, improved soil health and enhanced 
nutritional qualities.NON-GMO PROJECT VERIFIED 
As a founding member of the Non-GMO 
Project, we believe consumers have a right 
to know what’s in their food. That includes 
offering a wide array of non-GMO options.
FAIR TRADE CERTIFIED 
Through rigorous social, environmental and 
economic standards, Fair Trade Certified 
products help to improve livelihoods for 
producers and strengthen communities. 
ANIMAL WELFARE
We recognize the importance of healthy 
animals to ensure food quality and safety. 
As such, we aim to work with suppliers 
who share these same values. Our Supplier 
and Vendor Code of Conduct  conveys the 
expectation that our suppliers will promote 
animal welfare in their own operations. As a 
food distributor, we are focused on providing 
access to thousands of diverse products that 
help our grocery customers serve the needs of 
their communities and to meet the supply and 
demand from consumers. 
We continue to stand behind the internationally 
accepted “Five Freedoms” for animals and 
expect our suppliers to do the same.
SEAFOOD SUSTAINABILITY
Protecting our oceans is critical for maintaining 
the availability of seafood for future generations 
and the health of our planet.
We are committed to providing our customers 
with high-quality, sustainable, and traceable 
wild-caught and farm-raised seafood from 
environmentally and socially responsible 
sources. Through our new partnership with 
the Global Aquaculture Alliance (GAA), we are 
working to improve transparency within our 
seafood supply chain, to protect the oceans, 
and to provide fair and equitable treatment 
for the people who depend on them for their 
livelihoods.
